document_title: Stevens Johnson syndrome (SJS): Causes, signs, treatment
subsection_content:
Stevens-Johnson syndrome cannot be prevented because the main cause comes from oral medications. The best way to prevent this is to not use the drug that caused the allergic reaction. Because if you take that medicine a second time, there is a high risk of skin peeling, the progression will be more severe than the first allergy, and even face the risk of death.
Each patient with Stevens-Johnson syndrome may exhibit different symptoms. The damaged skin may heal within a few weeks, but recovery can take several months if the patient has severe symptoms. Some long-term reactions may develop, including:
Skin: dry, itchy, changes in skin color; Eyes: chronic swelling and/or dryness, chronic irritation, difficulty seeing, sensitivity to light (photophobia).; Excessive sweating.; Lung damage, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, asthma.; Loss or deformation of nails; Hair loss (alopecia).; Dry mucous membranes, which can cause problems with urination; Chronic fatigue syndrome.; Having problems with taste
In addition, after being treated for Stevens-Johnson disease, patients should be careful to keep the blistered skin area clean. Clean with povidine or methylene blue if blisters are still open. If the blisters have crusted over, just keep it clean. Prioritize eating food groups that increase resistance so the body can recover quickly.
Dr. Dang Thi Ngoc Bich is the person who laid the first brick, building and promoting the work of both skin medical examination and treatment and skin aesthetics at the Tam Anh General Hospital system in Ho Chi Minh City. In particular, Tam Anh General Hospital in Ho Chi Minh City has the advantage of modern machinery and equipment, a team of highly skilled doctors and technicians, and a convenient location for people to examine skin diseases and skin aesthetics. safe and effective.
To schedule an examination and treatment with a Dermatologist at Tam Anh General Hospital System, you can choose from the following options:
Contact hotline 0287 102 6789 - 093 180 6858 (HCMC) or 024 3872 3872 - 024 7106 6858 (Hanoi) to register for a private examination with a specialist.; Register for an appointment at the link: https://tamanhhospital.vn/danh-cho-khach-hang/dat-lich-kham/; Send a message on Tam Anh General Hospital Fanpage.; Text message via Zalo OA of Tam Anh General Hospital.
Although Stevens Johnson syndrome is quite rare, the mortality rate is quite high. Therefore, when you notice any signs of the disease, you should immediately go to the nearest hospital or medical facility for testing, diagnosis and timely treatment.
